template.name: userdom_base_user_template
template.summary: The template containing the most basic rules common to all users.

desc.p: The template containing the most basic rules common to all users.
This template creates a user domain, types, and rules for the user's tty and pty.

param.name: userdomain_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the user domain (e.g., user is the prefix for user_t).

template.name: userdom_ro_home_template
template.summary: The template for creating a home directory that the user has read-only access.

desc.p: The template for creating a home directory that the user has read-only access.
This does not allow execute access.

param.name: userdomain_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the user domain (e.g., user is the prefix for user_t).

template.name: userdom_manage_home_template
template.summary: The template for creating a home directory that the user has full access.

desc.p: The template for creating a home directory that the user has full access.
This does not allow execute access.

param.name: userdomain_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the user domain (e.g., user is the prefix for user_t).

template.name: userdom_exec_home_template
template.summary: The template for allowing the user to execute files in their home directory.

param.name: userdomain_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the user domain (e.g., user is the prefix for user_t).

template.name: userdom_poly_home_template
template.summary: The template for polyinstantiating a user home directory.

param.name: userdomain_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the user domain (e.g., user is the prefix for user_t).

template.name: userdom_manage_tmp_template
template.summary: The template for full access to the temporary directories.

desc.p: The template for full access to the temporary directories. This creates a derived type for the user temporary type. Execute access is not given.

param.name: userdomain_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the user domain (e.g., user is the prefix for user_t).

template.name: userdom_exec_tmp_template
template.summary: The template for execute access to the user temporary files.

param.name: userdomain_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the user domain (e.g., user is the prefix for user_t).

template.name: userdom_poly_tmp_template
template.summary: The template for a polyinstantiated temporary directory.

param.name: userdomain_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the user domain (e.g., user is the prefix for user_t).

template.name: userdom_manage_tmpfs_template
template.summary: The template for creating a tmpfs type that the user has full access.

desc.p: The template for creating a tmpfs type that the user has full access.
This does not allow execute access.

param.name: userdomain_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the user domain (e.g., user is the prefix for user_t).

template.name: userdom_untrusted_content_template
template.summary: The template for creating a set of types for untrusted content.

param.name: userdomain_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the user domain (e.g., user is the prefix for user_t).

template.name: userdom_exec_generic_pgms_template
template.summary: The template allowing the user to execute generic programs, such as those found in /bin, /sbin, /usr/bin, and /usr/sbin.

param.name: userdomain_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the user domain (e.g., user is the prefix for user_t).

template.name: userdom_basic_networking_template
template.summary: The template allowing the user basic network permissions

param.name: userdomain_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the user domain (e.g., user is the prefix for user_t).

template.name: userdom_xwindows_client_template
template.summary: The template for creating a user xwindows client.

param.name: userdomain_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the user domain (e.g., user is the prefix for user_t).

template.name: userdom_change_password_template
template.summary: The template for allowing the user to change passwords.

param.name: userdomain_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the user domain (e.g., user is the prefix for user_t).

template.name: userdom_role_change_template
template.summary: The template for allowing the user to change roles.

param.name: userdomain_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the user domain (e.g., user is the prefix for user_t).

template.name: userdom_common_user_template
template.summary: The template containing rules common to unprivileged users and administrative users.

desc.p: This template creates a user domain, types, and rules for the user's tty, pty, tmp, and tmpfs files.

param.name: userdomain_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the user domain (e.g., user is the prefix for user_t).

template.name: userdom_unpriv_user_template
template.summary: The template for creating a unprivileged user.

desc.p: This template creates a user domain, types, and rules for the user's tty, pty, home directories, tmp, and tmpfs files.

param.name: userdomain_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the user domain (e.g., user is the prefix for user_t).

template.name: userdom_admin_user_template
template.summary: The template for creating an administrative user.

desc.p: This template creates a user domain, types, and rules for the user's tty, pty, home directories, tmp, and tmpfs files.

The privileges given to administrative users are:
Raw disk access
Set all sysctls
All kernel ring buffer controls
Create, read, write, and delete all files but shadow
Manage source and binary format SELinux policy
Run insmod

param.name: userdomain_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the user domain (e.g., sysadm is the prefix for sysadm_t).

template.name: userdom_security_admin_template
template.summary: Allow user to run as a secadm

desc.p: Create objects in a user home directory with an automatic type transition to a specified private type.
This is a templated interface, and should only be called from a per-userdomain template.

param.name: userdomain_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the user domain (e.g., user is the prefix for user_t).

param.name: role
param.summary: The role of the object to create.

template.name: userdom_user_home_domtrans
template.summary: Do a domain transition to the specified domain when executing a program in the user home directory.

desc.p: Do a domain transition to the specified domain when executing a program in the user home directory.
No interprocess communication (signals, pipes, etc.) is provided by this interface since the domains are not owned by this module.
This is a templated interface, and should only be called from a per-userdomain template.

param.name: userdomain_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the user domain (e.g., user is the prefix for user_t).

interface.name: userdom_spec_domtrans_all_users
interface.summary: Execute a shell in all user domains. This is an explicit transition, requiring the caller to use setexeccon().

interface.name: userdom_xsession_spec_domtrans_all_users
interface.summary: Execute an Xserver session in all unprivileged user domains. This is an explicit transition, requiring the caller to use setexeccon().

interface.name: userdom_spec_domtrans_unpriv_users
interface.summary: Execute a shell in all unprivileged user domains. This is an explicit transition, requiring the caller to use setexeccon().

interface.name: userdom_xsession_spec_domtrans_unpriv_users
interface.summary: Execute an Xserver session in all unprivileged user domains. This is an explicit transition, requiring the caller to use setexeccon().

interface.name: userdom_manage_unpriv_user_semaphores
interface.summary: Manage unpriviledged user SysV sempaphores.

interface.name: userdom_manage_unpriv_user_shared_mem
interface.summary: Manage unpriviledged user SysV shared memory segments.

interface.name: userdom_bin_spec_domtrans_unpriv_users
interface.summary: Execute bin_t in the unprivileged user domains. This is an explicit transition, requiring the caller to use setexeccon().

interface.name: userdom_sbin_spec_domtrans_unpriv_users
interface.summary: Execute generic sbin programs in all unprivileged user domains. This is an explicit transition, requiring the caller to use setexeccon().

interface.name: userdom_entry_spec_domtrans_unpriv_users
interface.summary: Execute all entrypoint files in unprivileged user domains. This is an explicit transition, requiring the caller to use setexeccon().

interface.name: userdom_shell_domtrans_sysadm
interface.summary: Execute a shell in the sysadm domain.

interface.name: userdom_bin_spec_domtrans_sysadm
interface.summary: Execute a generic bin program in the sysadm domain.

interface.name: userdom_sbin_spec_domtrans_sysadm
interface.summary: Execute a generic sbin program in the sysadm domain. (Deprecated)

interface.name: userdom_entry_spec_domtrans_sysadm
interface.summary: Execute all entrypoint files in the sysadm domain. This is an explicit transition, requiring the caller to use setexeccon().

interface.name: userdom_sysadm_bin_spec_domtrans_to
interface.summary: Allow sysadm to execute a generic bin program in a specified domain. This is an explicit transition, requiring the caller to use setexeccon(). (Deprecated)

desc.p: Allow sysadm to execute a generic bin program in a specified domain. (Deprecated)
This is a interface to support third party modules and its use is not allowed in upstream reference policy.

interface.name: userdom_sysadm_sbin_spec_domtrans_to
interface.summary: Allow sysadm to execute a generic sbin program in a specified domain. This is an explicit transition, requiring the caller to use setexeccon(). (Deprecated)

desc.p: Allow sysadm to execute a generic sbin program in a specified domain. (Deprecated)
This is a interface to support third party modules and its use is not allowed in upstream reference policy.

interface.name: userdom_sysadm_entry_spec_domtrans_to
interface.summary: Allow sysadm to execute all entrypoint files in the specified domain. This is an explicit transition, requiring the caller to use setexeccon().

desc.p: Allow sysadm to execute all entrypoint files in the specified domain. This is an explicit transition, requiring the caller to use setexeccon().
This is a interface to support third party modules and its use is not allowed in upstream reference policy.

interface.name: userdom_priveleged_home_dir_manager

desc.p: Allow sysadm to ptrace all processes
Allow users to connect to mysql
Allow regular users direct mouse access
Allow users to read system messages.
Allow user to r/w files on filesystems that do not have extended attributes (FAT, CDROM, FLOPPY)
Allow w to display everyone
